question.text:
Which of the following conditions are seen because of the structure and arrangement of flowers in maize and papaya?
 
    Maize Papaya
I. Autogamy Prevented Prevented
Geitonogamy Prevented Prevented
II. Autogamy Prevented Prevented
Geitonogamy Prevented Allowed
III. Autogamy Allowed Prevented
Geitonogamy Prevented Allowed
IV. Autogamy Prevented Prevented
Geitonogamy Allowed Prevented

solution.text:
Autogamy is a type of pollination in which pollen grains produced by one flower are deposited on the stigma of the same flower. Geitonogamy is a type of pollination in which pollen grains produced by one flower are deposited on the stigma of another flower but on the same plant.

Zea mays or maize produces unisexual flowers. The male flowers and female flowers present on the same plant. Thus, it is a monoecious plant. In this autogamy is prevented but geitonogamy will occur.

Carica papaya or papaya also produces unisexual flowers. The male flowers and female flowers present on different plants. Thus, it is a dioecious plant. In this, both autogamy and geitonogamy are prevented.
